title: How to Clean Up Your Instagram Account List

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. This app icon looks like a camera lens icon on a pink and purple gradient background.

steps.title: Navigate to your profile.
steps.content: Navigate to your profile. Tap your profile picture icon in the bottom right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Select the account you want to remove from your list of accounts using the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Select the account you want to remove from your list of accounts using the drop-down menu. It's either near the top left corner or centered in the middle of your screen.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This three-line menu icon is in the upper right corner of your screen and will prompt a menu to drop down.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's usually the first item in the menu next to a gear icon. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Log out X.
steps.content: Tap Log out X . "X" is your Instagram username. You may have to scroll down to find this at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Not now.
steps.content: Tap Not now . Since you don't want this account to log in automatically with saved login information, you want to tap Not now to prevent this from happening. Confirm by tapping Log out . That account will no longer appear as an option if you tap the drop-down at the top of the screen and you will no longer get notifications regarding that account. [2] X Research source
